institution: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
award_title: Collaborative Research: Decoding the Aero-Structural Dynamics of Feathered Wings in Flapping Flight via Computational Models
subject: Making computational bird flight models reusable
body:
Hi Tyson,

I saw your NSF award on computational modeling of bird flight. The models you're building sound genuinely useful beyond your immediate work.

Problem is, even great computational methods usually die in papersâ€”hard for others to actually use, harder to show real-world impact when NSF asks.

I'm working on Ouro, basically infrastructure that makes published computational methods callable by others. It's meant to make reuse and accessibility easier to demonstrate, not just claim.

Would you be open to a quick chat in the new year?

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
